newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: SPECULATION, IMPORT PRESSURE HIT ZIMBABWE DOLLAR.
newsitem.headline: SPECULATION, IMPORT PRESSURE HIT ZIMBABWE DOLLAR.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar lost almost four cents to the U.S. dollar on Wednesday, hit by a wave of speculation and heavy import pressure, foreign exchange dealers said.
"The dollar lost almost four cents since morning," one foreign exchange dealer said.

"There's now an element of speculation because as soon as the dollar starts sliding people tend to hold on to their long positions. It's not just importer demand anymore which has hit the dollar and the Reserve Bank didn't come in at all," he said.
Earlier, the central Reserve Bank lowered its key rediscount rate to 27 percent from 27.5 percent, citing a decline in annual inflation.
At Wednesday's close, the local unit was quoted at 10.5600/5800 on the U.S. currency from its 10.5250/5450 late Tuesday position.

It also lost ground to sterling, ending at 16.7510/7920 from 16.6510/6920 and was quoted at 6.8570/8730 on the mark compared to 6.8390/8530. It was marginally weaker on the rand at 2.3190/3250 versus 2.3170/3230.
